column4: Conwy Castle is a castle that was built in the Middle Ages.
column5: Conwy Castle is a fortification in Conwy, located in North Wales.

column4: Conwy Castle is a castle that was built in the Middle Ages.
column5: It was built by Edward I, during his conquest of Wales, between 1283 and 1289.

column4: Conwy Castle is a castle that was built in the Middle Ages.
column5: Constructed as part of a wider project to create the walled town of Conwy, the combined defences cost around £15,000, a huge sum for the period.

column4: Conwy Castle is a castle that was built in the Middle Ages.
column5: Over the next few centuries, the castle played an important part in several wars.

column4: Conwy Castle is a castle that was built in the Middle Ages.
column5: It withstood the siege of Madog ap Llywelyn in the winter of 1294–95, acted as a temporary haven for Richard II in 1399 and was held for several months by forces loyal to Owain Glyndŵr in 1401.
